what: Overview of available datasets in idswb package
title: Exploration of International Debt Statistics from World Bank
text: unique_counterpart_area: information counterparts (creditors) unique_country: information debtors unique_series: information series unique_time: information years
code: unique_counterpart_area %>% head() %>% kable() unique_country %>% head() %>% kable() unique_series %>% head() %>% kable() unique_time %>% head() %>% kable()

title: Exploration of International Debt Statistics from World Bank
text: create ETL object specifying string defines object’s class, use package idswb gain access relevant data.
code: # ceating an object idswb_ob <-etl("idswb", dir = getwd()) #> No database was specified so I created one for you at: #> /Users/reubenopondo/Data Science/projects/clients/teal-insights/p5-idswb/idswb/file261931e23274.sqlite3

title: Exploration of International Debt Statistics from World Bank
text: first step acquire data

title: Exploration of International Debt Statistics from World Bank
text: data might require conversion original format files appropriate SQL import, typically CSV format.

title: Exploration of International Debt Statistics from World Bank
text: Fill SQL database processed data. can still perform steps
code: idswb_ob %>% etl_load() #> Loading data to the database... # ceating an object idswb_ob <-etl("idswb", dir = getwd())  idswb_ob %>%    # extract   etl_extract() %>%    # transform   etl_transform() %>%    # load   etl_load()

title: Exploration of International Debt Statistics from World Bank
text: can now query debt given country owes China World follows using get_debt() function
code: dplyr::tbl(idswb_ob, "ids_wb") %>%    # query data   dplyr::filter(wb_debtor_country_name == "Kenya",          wb_creditor_name %in% c("China","World"),          api_code %in% c("DT.DOD.BLAT.CD",                          "DT.DOD.PBND.CD",                          'DT.DOD.MLAT.CD',                          "DT.DOD.PROP.CD",                          "DT.DOD.PCBK.CD",                          "DT.DOD.DPPG.CD")) %>%    dplyr::collect() %>%    # gather data   gather(key = year,value = debt,-c(api_code, data_last_updated, series_full_name, wb_debtor_country_name, wb_debtor_country_id,                                       wb_creditor_name, wb_creditor_id)) %>%    filter(year == 2022) %>%    mutate(data_last_updated = as_datetime(as.numeric(data_last_updated))) %>%    knitr::kable() dplyr::tbl(idswb_ob, "ids_wb") %>%    # query data   dplyr::filter(wb_debtor_country_name == "Nigeria",          wb_creditor_name %in% c("China","World"),          api_code %in% c("DT.DOD.BLAT.CD",                          "DT.DOD.PBND.CD",                          'DT.DOD.MLAT.CD',                          "DT.DOD.PROP.CD",                          "DT.DOD.PCBK.CD",                          "DT.DOD.DPPG.CD")) %>%    dplyr::collect() %>%    # gather data   gather(key = year,value = debt,-c(api_code, data_last_updated, series_full_name, wb_debtor_country_name, wb_debtor_country_id,                                       wb_creditor_name, wb_creditor_id)) %>%    filter(year == 2022) %>%    mutate(data_last_updated = as_datetime(as.numeric(data_last_updated))) %>%    knitr::kable()
